visitrwanda.title: Why Rwanda is a Great Business Destination
visitrwanda.subtitle: Explore why Rwanda is the best place to invest and grow your business in Africa.

benefits.title: Easy & Fast Business Setup
benefits.description: Register a company in just 6 hours.
benefits.moreDescription: With streamlined digital services and a dedicated investment promotion agency, setting up a business in Rwanda is fast and straightforward.

benefits.title: Full Ownership & Tax Benefits
benefits.moreDescription: Investors enjoy full repatriation of profits, tax holidays, and zero import duties for strategic sectors.

benefits.title: Strategic Location
benefits.moreDescription: Rwanda is centrally located in Africa, providing easy access to multiple regional markets including EAC and AfCFTA.

benefits.title: Safe & Business-Friendly
benefits.moreDescription: Rwanda boasts low crime rates, stable leadership, and a zero-tolerance policy on corruption, making it a haven for business.

benefits.title: Modern Infrastructure & Innovation
benefits.moreDescription: From fiber-optic internet to smart city planning, Rwanda is investing heavily in 21st-century infrastructure.

benefits.title: Green & Sustainable Economy
benefits.moreDescription: The government supports clean tech, electric mobility, and sustainable agriculture through targeted policies and grants.

whyinvest.title: Ready to invest?
whyinvest.subtitle: Bonet Elite Services makes the process seamless. Let’s get started today!

card.heading: How Bonet can help investors set up and grow
card.subheading: How Bonet Elite Services Simplifies Business Setup and Growth
paragraphs: Setting up and running a business in Rwanda should be exciting, not overwhelming. At Bonet Elite Services, we take the hassle out of business registration and licensing by handling everything for you, seamlessly and efficiently.
Whether you're an investor seeking an Investment Certificate, an entrepreneur launching a startup, or an established business needing sector-specific permits, we ensure a smooth, stress-free process.

From paperwork to approvals, we navigate the complexities so you don’t have to. With our expertise, you save time, avoid delays, and focus on what truly matters – growing your business with confidence.

investmentOpportunities.title: Investment Opportunities in Rwanda
investmentOpportunities.subtitle: Explore why Rwanda is one of the best places in Africa to invest and grow your business.

items.title: MANUFACTURING
items.description: The Rwanda industrial policy aims at increasing domestic production, improving export competitiveness and creating an enabling environment for industrialisation. The manufacturing sector is currently dominated by construction materials manufacturing and agro-processing subsectors, mainly due to local availability of raw materials and the booming construction sector.

items.title: AGRICULTURE
items.description: Rwanda's agriculture sector plays a vital role in the economy, contributing significantly to employment and GDP. The government is focused on modernizing agriculture through mechanization, irrigation, and value addition.

items.title: ENERGY
items.description: The Rwandan government aims to increase electricity access and encourage renewable energy investments. Hydropower, solar energy, and methane gas extraction are key focus areas.

items.title: TOURISM
items.description: Rwanda is a top tourism destination in Africa, known for its mountain gorillas, national parks, and cultural heritage. The government actively promotes sustainable tourism and eco-lodges.

items.title: ICT (INFORMATION AND COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGY)
items.description: Rwanda has established itself as an ICT hub in Africa, with the government promoting a digital economy through various initiatives. The ICT sector presents vast investment potential.

items.title: REAL ESTATE & CONSTRUCTION
items.description: With rapid urbanization, Rwanda has a growing demand for modern infrastructure, residential housing, and commercial properties.

items.title: INFRASTRUCTURE
items.description: Rwanda is investing heavily in infrastructure development to support economic growth and regional integration. The government is promoting public-private partnerships to accelerate infrastructure projects.

items.title: MINING
items.description: Rwanda has a rich mineral sector, with government policies supporting responsible mining and value addition. The country is a key producer of tantalum, tin, and tungsten.

spots.title: Volcanoes National Park
spots.description: Home to Rwanda’s famous mountain gorillas, this park offers breathtaking landscapes and a unique wildlife experience. Visitors can embark on guided gorilla trekking expeditions, where they can witness these majestic primates in their natural habitat. The park is also home to golden monkeys, lush bamboo forests, and stunning volcanic scenery. It is a paradise for eco-tourists, photographers, and wildlife enthusiasts who wish to explore one of the last remaining mountain gorilla sanctuaries on Earth.

spots.title: Nyungwe National Park
spots.description: A vast montane rainforest, Nyungwe is one of Africa’s oldest rainforests, teeming with biodiversity. The park boasts a rich ecosystem filled with over 1,000 plant species, 13 primate species including chimpanzees, and more than 300 bird species, making it a haven for birdwatchers. One of its highlights is the famous Canopy Walkway, a suspension bridge hanging 60 meters above the forest floor, offering breathtaking views of the lush greenery and diverse wildlife below. Visitors can also enjoy hiking trails that lead to beautiful waterfalls and scenic viewpoints.

spots.title: Akagera National Park
spots.description: This savannah park is home to the Big Five—lions, leopards, elephants, buffalo, and rhinos—offering an authentic African safari experience. Unlike other Rwandan parks, Akagera is characterized by wide open plains, woodlands, lakes, and wetlands, creating a diverse and beautiful landscape. Boat safaris on Lake Ihema allow visitors to see hippos, crocodiles, and numerous waterbirds up close. The park has undergone extensive conservation efforts, successfully reintroducing lions and rhinos, making it a must-visit destination for wildlife lovers.

spots.title: Kigali Genocide Memorial
spots.description: A place of remembrance and education, this memorial honors the victims of the 1994 Genocide against the Tutsi, providing deep insights into Rwanda’s history and resilience. The site features exhibits that detail the events leading up to the genocide, the horrors that unfolded, and the efforts of Rwandans to rebuild their nation. Visitors can pay their respects at the mass graves and learn about personal survivor testimonies, fostering a deeper understanding of Rwanda’s journey towards reconciliation and peace.

spots.title: Lake Kivu
spots.description: One of Africa’s Great Lakes, Lake Kivu offers stunning views, relaxing boat rides, and vibrant lakeside towns such as Gisenyi, Kibuye, and Cyangugu. The lake's crystal-clear waters are free of dangerous wildlife, making it perfect for swimming, kayaking, and fishing. Visitors can explore coffee plantations nearby, take a sunset cruise, or simply relax on the shores while enjoying the breathtaking landscape. With its warm and welcoming atmosphere, Lake Kivu is an ideal retreat for those looking to unwind and enjoy nature.

spots.title: King’s Palace Museum (Rukari)
spots.description: This historical site in Nyanza showcases Rwanda’s royal heritage, featuring a reconstructed traditional palace with thatched-roof architecture. Visitors can learn about the history of Rwanda’s monarchy, the customs and traditions of past kings, and see the Inyambo (sacred long-horned cattle), which were traditionally groomed for royal ceremonies. The museum provides fascinating insights into pre-colonial Rwanda, offering a unique cultural experience that highlights the nation’s rich history and legacy.

investingInRwanda.title: How to Start a Business in Rwanda as a Foreigner

whyInvest.title: Why Invest in Rwanda?
whyInvest.text: Rwanda ranks 38th globally and 2nd in Africa for ease of doing business. With an online registration process that takes just six hours, it is an attractive investment destination.

prepare.title: Prepare for Registration
items: Have an active email address.
Keep your ID or Passport ready.
Determine your company name, business activities, and office address.
Collect shareholders’, board members’, and directors’ particulars.

documents.title: Necessary Documents
items: Notarized Power of Attorney.
Notarized Memorandum Articles of Association.
Notarized Certificate of Registration/Incorporation.
Notarized Resolution authorizing the opening of a branch.

registerOnline.title: Register Online
items: Access the RDB business registration system.
Choose the appropriate business category.
Complete the business registration application online.

taxes.title: Register, Declare, and Pay Taxes
items: Register for taxes, including VAT if applicable.
Ensure compliance with all tax obligations.
Seek tax advisory for proper guidance.

keyInfo.title: Key Information
items: No business registration fees required.
Company registration takes only 6 hours.
The entire process is online, eliminating the need for physical presence.

step2.title: Step 2: Requirements to Get an Investment Certificate

onlineApplication.title: Online Application
items: Apply online at osc.rdb.rw.
Obtain a Company Incorporation Certificate from RDB.
Use the Company Code/TIN for online applications.

applicationLetter.title: Application Letter
applicationLetter.text: Write an application letter addressed to the CEO of Rwanda Development Board requesting an Investment Certificate.

businessPlan.title: Business Plan Requirements
items: Executive Summary: Outline the key aspects of the project.
Project Promoter(s) Profile: Details about the people behind the project.
Project Background: Information on the origins and development of the project.
Market Study/Analysis: Insights into market conditions and potential.
Financial Information: Level of loan and equity financing, if any.
Projected Income and Expenditure: Statements for the next 5 years.
Planned Investment: Financial schedule & capital cost for the next 5 years.
Projected Balance Sheet: Financial projections for the next 5 years.
Loan Amortization Schedule: If any bank loans are involved.
